Record.ClassificationPath: Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Skin Diseases/Skin Ulcer/Leg Ulcer/Varicose Ulcer
Record.Description: Skin breakdown or ulceration caused by varicose veins in which there is too much hydrostatic pressure in the superficial venous system of the leg. Venous hypertension leads to increased pressure in the capillary bed, transudation of fluid and proteins into the interstitial space, altering blood flow and supply of nutrients to the skin and subcutaneous tissues, and eventual ulceration.
